SEARCH
Package edu.carroll.initMusic.web.controller

Class ChangePasswordAlreadyLoggedInController

java.lang.Object
edu.carroll.initMusic.web.controller.ChangePasswordAlreadyLoggedInController
@Controller public class ChangePasswordAlreadyLoggedInController extends Object
Controller for handling password changes for users who are already logged in. This controller manages the flow for users to change their passwords securely. It checks the old password, validates the new password, and updates the user's password if valid.

  • Method Details

    • showChangePasswordLoggedIn

      @GetMapping("/changePasswordLoggedIn") public String showChangePasswordLoggedIn()
      Displays the form for changing the password when the user is already logged in.
      Returns:
      the name of the Thymeleaf template for changing the password

    • handleSecuritySubmission

      @PostMapping("/changePasswordLoggedIn") public String handleSecuritySubmission(@ModelAttribute NewPasswordForm passwordForm, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles the form submission for changing the password. This method verifies that the old password matches the user's current password. If the old password is correct, it updates the password to the new one. If not, it displays an error message.
      Parameters:
      passwordForm - the form containing the old and new passwords
      authentication - the current authentication token, used to retrieve the logged-in user
      model - the model used to pass data back to the view
      Returns:
      the view to display next, either a success page or the form with an error
